document.bingtitle: Cracker Barrel Valentines Gift Basket Giveaway
document.webtitle: Cracker Barrel Valentines Gift Basket Giveaway
document.description: ... love not having to wonder what might be in my food ... I usually order chicken and dumplins with an extra ... meal for the same amount I would spend at a fast food restaurant.
document.body:
Journal Kids Fun Tips Military Making it in the Military Military Commissary Deals Disney Archives
Cracker Barrel Valentines Gift Basket Giveaway January 29, 2012 Since this week I’m celebrating my four year blogging anniversary I thought it would be fun to host some giveaways!
I know you are going to love this first giveaway sponsored by Cracker Barrel. Just typing the name makes me hungry for their delicious cornbread, but I digress.
I have this awesome Valentine’s gift basket to give to one reader.
Included in the gift basket are Valentine’s Day treats, tidbit plates, mugs, and lots of other fun products from Cracker Barrel’s Old Country Store. You can check out all of Cracker Barrel’s Valentine’s Day treats on their website and enter to win this gift basket for yourself!
Divide up all the goodies in this gift basket to give as gifts or give yourself a little gift this Valentine’s Day!
To enter the giveaway leave a comment sharing what you love about Cracker Barrel. For additional entries you can follow Cracker Barrel on Twitter or “Like”them on Facebook . Please leave an additional comment for each extra entry.
Giveaway ends January 31, 2012.
Tweet
This post may contain a link to an affiliate. See my disclosure policy for more information.

Omigosh, do I love Cracker Barrel biscuits….. Angela from Sunny San Diego says: January 29, 2012 at 11:01 pm I LOOOVE Cracker Barrel. I had never been to one let alone heard of one til I married a southern boy in 1999. Lived in Alabama for 6 years and fell in love with Cracker Barrel and all the yummy delights they have. I could spend all day looking around in the store and have purchased many things there. I love Cracker Barrel so much that last weekend a few girlfriends and I drove THREE HOURS from San Diego, CA to Yuma, AZ to eat at Cracker Barrel. Now if that isn’t dedication I don’t know what is. I LOVE the sweet tea, corn muffins, spiced apple butter and their hasbrown casserole. Delish!!!! SalBug says: January 29, 2012 at 11:15 pm I love everything there! But if I have to say one thing, it would be the mac&cheese. We love the ambiance, the fireplace, the worn wooden floors….It is how I want my home to feel, comfortable, familiar like visiting an old friend and always being welcomed. We love their rockers and cannot wait for the day we can buy some for our porch…their food is delicious and we have always had good service.. alizabeth says: January 30, 2012 at 9:49 am Liked them on Face Book too! I love the games on the table, I love how it feels like your at home with all the great country living. I love the gift shop and especially the CLEARANCE ISLE! The pancakes are MY favorite, the buttery crisp edges with a sweet syrup topping….oh, I wanna go NOW! This set would sure be a delightful valentine gift! Thanks for sharing it with us! I also love their country store Kisti Huffman says: January 30, 2012 at 12:47 pm I love their concern for good service. Our local restaurant gave us a free meal (all 4 of us) plus gave us an additional gift card for anything we wanted on our next meal (for 4). They had been especially busy and had messed up part of our order. The manager was great at making sure we were taken care of. Kisti Huffman says: January 30, 2012 at 12:48 pm I just“liked”Cracker Barrel. Angie V says: January 30, 2012 at 12:50 pm Love the Cracker Barrel, has become a vacation must when we travel to Florida from Ohio. There is one in Georgia we always stop at. Love the staff and the ability to everyone have choices to eat what they want. Love walking though the shop and seeing what all is new. Always find a clean restroom which is wonderful when traveling. Angi says: January 30, 2012 at 12:51 pm I love that I can feed my family a nutritious meal when we are out and about, AND it doesn’t cost much more than fast food. Angie V says: January 30, 2012 at 12:52 pm Thanks for allowing us to enter this wonderful giveaway. I also follow them on FB Carmen at Old House Kitchen says: January 30, 2012 at 12:55 pm I love the down-home country feel about the Cracker Barrel! Yee haw! Their food is good too. Amy C. says: January 30, 2012 at 1:13 pm Oh, and we also love shopping in their little store–the old timey candies, Christmas ornaments, small toys for road trip treats, etc. Great stuff in there! Would love to win the basket! Jitka says: January 30, 2012 at 1:19 pm I love their biscuits and crackers:) Kristy says: January 30, 2012 at 1:30 pm I love browsing through the country store!
